"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c6a36368722796070000#post_5320c6a36368722796070000
Yesterday i slept from 7 am to 4 pm.
The day before that i slept from 9 am to 11 pm.
And the day before that it was from 3:30 am to 3 pm.

It can move literally around the clock within a single week.

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c86f63687270e0010100#post_5320c86f63687270e0010100
By any chance would any medication help with the problem?

I'm just suggesting things here, I too sleep whenever as well but that's probably just my stress or something.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c9296368726c9da30200#post_5320c9296368726c9da30200
Melatonin is a good, natural sleep aid, you should try it if you haven't. It works well and has no negative side effects, but tends to become less effective the longer you use it. That's the deal with any sleep aid, really. There isn't a real permanent, reliable solution to this. At least yet.
topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c74e63687270e0b00000#post_5320c74e63687270e0b00000
[bq="PaskaNaakka"]"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c6a36368722796070000#post_5320c6a36368722796070000
Yesterday i slept from 7 am to 4 pm.
The day before that i slept from 9 am to 11 pm.
And the day before that it was from 3:30 am to 3 pm.

It can move literally around the clock within a single week.[/bq]

"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c86f63687270e0010100#post_5320c86f63687270e0010100
[bq="PaskaNaakka"]"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5320c7aa63687244ab140000#post_5320c7aa63687244ab140000
I was diagnosed with regular old DSPD about four years ago. Then it was just that i couldn't sleep before 5 am, but it was still regular. Since then it's become kind of free flowing like that.[/bq]

You call it a disorder, I call it an important skill. With my job I go from time zone to time zone almost every day and there are times when I need to wake up at 5 am and other times when I need to work until the early hours of the morning. My sleep schedule is all over the place. Over the past few months I have basically become able to sleep anytime I want. I can pull an all nighter with ease and even work a full 24 hours with no sleep then spend the entire next day resting only to get up at 7 am the following day. I need to be able to be flexible like that.
